SENT.plain: Treatment planning for patients with skeletal deformities is often considered challenging
This article reports a female patient with achondroplasia who presented with severe maxillary retrognathism and vertical excess along with anterior open bite
The clinical and cephalometric findings of the patient are detailed here
The treatment plan consisted of modified anterior maxillary osteotomy for simultaneous vertical and sagittal augmentation along with orthodontic intervention
The course of surgical-orthodontic treatment and the results are presented
This treatment is to be followed by correction of vertical maxillary excess after completion of growth
This paper concludes that the dentoalveolar component of a skeletal deformity can be handled independent of the craniofacial management
